Hello God_is_real:
 Remember 1 Peter 3:15. I always thought that Catholic people are Christians. To be a Christian is basically a follower of Jesus Christ. There are two types of Christians, the Catholic and the Protestant. The Protestant type can be divided into the many different denominations, such as Salvation Army, Baptist and so on. We have different doctrinal beliefs to the Catholics, they tend to focus more on the Saints and Mary than we do (I think). We like to focus on Jesus more and the message of the Good News. So to hold that Catholic people are not Christians .... I wouldn't hold such a view.

 Getting back on track to the topic at hand, which way would Jesus have voted?
 
 This is pasted from "God is not a Republican" post 8, but for the most part deals with the issue (though some of the responses are specific to the that thread)
 God, I believe, being about Love and compassion, would be left-wing (excepting so many of them are themselves irreligious - as one myself, every time I've gone to protests etc by left-leaning groups they seem to be filled with atheists).
 
 From the Bible we have good words for the meek. Jesus said the love of money is the root of all evil, and spent time, for the most part with the plebs.
 
 More specifically we have
 Acts 9:36
 In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha (which, when translated, is Dorcas[ 9:36 Both Tabitha (Aramaic) and Dorcas (Greek) mean gazelle.] ), who was always doing good and helping the poor.
 Acts 10:31
 and said, 'Cornelius, God has heard your prayer and remembered your gifts to the poor.
 2 Corinthians 9:9
 As it is written: "He has scattered abroad his gifts to the poor; his righteousness endures forever."[ 9:9 Psalm 112:9]
 
 Acts 8:9ff deals with someone who tried to buy the gifts of the Holy Spirit, and who was rejected.
 
 Acts 5:1ff deals with someone who tried to hog money, and who was struck down dead.
 
 Most telling for me was
 Acts 2:44 All the believers were together and had everything in common. 45 Selling their possessions and goods, they gave to anyone as he had need. 46 Every day they continued to meet together in the temple courts. They broke bread in their homes and ate together with glad and sincere hearts, 47 praising God and enjoying the favour of all the people. And the Lord added to their number daily those who were being saved.
 
 Common ownership of property is communism. Giving to those that need is very much alike "From each, according to his ability; to each, according to his need."--Karl Marx
 
 The main difference with communism is the belief in it that man is by himself perfectible - that one day we'll attain some kind of man-made paradise here on earth. This idea, that we can do so without God is why I find no comfort with most commuist/socialist groups.

 Actually, yes.
 
 Well - I still have a couple of chapters in the New Testament to get through (for my cover to cover read) - but have read already read through most of them in other study.
 
 Let me explain myself - 
 
 I don't believe in hell
 
 There are three words that have been translated into hell, the Hebrew sheol, the Greek Haides, and Gehena. Sheol literally means the pit, the grave, death. Haides was the Greek replacement for sheol. Gehena was a real place - pagans burned bodies there and eventually it was a place to burn trash. It was used more in reference to what would await one disobediant to God at the end, and Revelation does describe a fiery end to some - whether this be literal or figaurative I do not know. What I feel pretty confident on is that it will not be an eternity. A God of justice and love would not torture a person for all time, would not offer free will and then turn around and behave like a common thug by torturing anyone for any length of time. Plus there is Genesis. God made a promise of punishment for sin - it was not hell, it was death. Hell makes God a liar.
 
 I don't believe the dead go to heaven, either
 
 We just die. Cease to be. 
 
 For the living know that they will die, 
 but the dead know nothing; 
 they have no further reward, 
 and even the memory of them is forgotten. 
 Ecclesiastes 9:5
 
 Don't mistake me. I do beleive that eternal life is possible through Christ. But it will not begin until after the end of times when there will be a ressurection and the "meek will inherit the earth" and God will be with us. The Bible speaks of when the dead will rise from their memorial tombs and Revelation talks of when the dead will be judged.
 
 I don't believe in the Trinity
 
 The Father, Son and Holy Spirit are seperate, distinct entities. Christ is my savior and my king, however there is only one God and he is above both Christ and the Spirit.
 
 I sanity check my beliefs against Judaism
 
 Christ was a Jew. His life and work were prohesied by the Jews. The Bible was primarly penned by them. What they believe is highly relevant. 
 
 I don't dismiss science
 
 This goes with my final statement about the Creation. God created all. Science studies that creation. It's laws would be perfect as God is. When the Bible/Science/history don't match - we are missing some information.
 
 Example: When Christ died it is said the moon turned to blood. Science tells us there was a lunar eclipse that day. The moon is frequently red during a lunar eclipse.
 
 Too many Christians wait for the miraculous while failing to see it right in front of them. God made this world, this universe. Everything you see is a miracle. It's beautiful and interesting - and the fact that we don't have all the answers yet is really, really cool. God made life an adventure. But noooo, too many people want magic tricks. Ba HUMBUG to them!
 
 I don't have patience for hate of anyone in the name of God, for we were commanded to love first and that all other law hinges on that - and so many Christians forget that
 
 This is in Matthew 22:34-40
 34Hearing that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, the Pharisees got together. 35One of them, an expert in the law, tested him with this question: 
 36"Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the Law?" 37Jesus replied: " 'Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.'[2] 38This is the first and greatest commandment. 39And the second is like it: 'Love your neighbor as yourself.'[3] 40All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments." 
 
 I don't have much patience for mere sinners passing judgement anyone - (gays)
 
 Read the New Testament. It's everywhere. Read Romans - especially the second chapter (although people love to use Romans 1 TO judge - even though the whole thing is about how it is not the place of mere sinners to do so). Jesus said it, too. "Judge not lest ye be judged", "Let he who is not guilty of sin throw the first stone", "Why are you worrying about the splinter in your brother's eyes rather than the plank in your own?" For a one of us to pass judgement for God is WAY out of line. 
 
 I believe David had the upper hand - even without God on his side.
 
 Goliath was a giant - only one thing causes that is a disease called giganticism - basically growth hormones don't stop - you keep growing - everywhere. Eventually it leads to oversized organs, vision problems, and all kinds of trouble - most who suffer from this disease die young. My mother has a friend with it.
 
 Goliath's armor weighed over 100 pounds (anthropologists have discovered relics of this armor) - this would have also slowed him down.
 
 Slings were deadly and common weapons - ballistics experts have clocked them at 80 miles per hour.
 
 So even though it was God's will that David win, he operated within rules of his creation. 
 
 This is another great example of science and history and the Bible coming together. Not one account disproves the other. It is also another example of how the amazing is examplified in the every day - and we always miss it looking for magic acts.
 
 And I don't believe the word is more than the creation
 See above
God_is_real

 For the living know that they will die, 
 but the dead know nothing; 
 they have no further reward, 
 and even the memory of them is forgotten. 
 Ecclesiastes 9:5
 
 Don't mistake me. I do beleive that eternal life is possible through Christ. But it will not begin until after the end of times when there will be a ressurection and the "meek will inherit the earth" and God will be with us. The Bible speaks of when the dead will rise from their memorial tombs and Revelation talks of when the dead will be judged.
 
 I don't believe in the Trinity
 
 The Father, Son and Holy Spirit are seperate, distinct entities. Christ is my savior and my king, however there is only one God and he is above both Christ and the Spirit.
 
 I sanity check my beliefs against Judaism
 
 Christ was a Jew. His life and work were prohesied by the Jews. The Bible was primarly penned by them. What they believe is highly relevant. 
 
 I don't dismiss science
 
 This goes with my final statement about the Creation. God created all. Science studies that creation. It's laws would be perfect as God is. When the Bible/Science/history don't match - we are missing some information.
 
 Example: When Christ died it is said the moon turned to blood. Science tells us there was a lunar eclipse that day. The moon is frequently red during a lunar eclipse.
 
 Too many Christians wait for the miraculous while failing to see it right in front of them. God made this world, this universe. Everything you see is a miracle. It's beautiful and interesting - and the fact that we don't have all the answers yet is really, really cool. God made life an adventure. But noooo, too many people want magic tricks. Ba HUMBUG to them!
 
 I don't have patience for hate of anyone in the name of God, for we were commanded to love first and that all other law hinges on that - and so many Christians forget that
 
 This is in Matthew 22:34-40
 34Hearing that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, the Pharisees got together. 35One of them, an expert in the law, tested him with this question: 
 36"Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the Law?" 37Jesus replied: " 'Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.'[2] 38This is the first and greatest commandment. 39And the second is like it: 'Love your neighbor as yourself.'[3] 40All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments." 
 
 I don't have much patience for mere sinners passing judgement anyone - (gays)
 
 Read the New Testament. It's everywhere. Read Romans - especially the second chapter (although people love to use Romans 1 TO judge - even though the whole thing is about how it is not the place of mere sinners to do so). Jesus said it, too. "Judge not lest ye be judged", "Let he who is not guilty of sin throw the first stone", "Why are you worrying about the splinter in your brother's eyes rather than the plank in your own?" For a one of us to pass judgement for God is WAY out of line. 
 
 I believe David had the upper hand - even without God on his side.
 
 Goliath was a giant - only one thing causes that is a disease called giganticism - basically growth hormones don't stop - you keep growing - everywhere. Eventually it leads to oversized organs, vision problems, and all kinds of trouble - most who suffer from this disease die young. My mother has a friend with it.
 
 Goliath's armor weighed over 100 pounds (anthropologists have discovered relics of this armor) - this would have also slowed him down.
 
 Slings were deadly and common weapons - ballistics experts have clocked them at 80 miles per hour.
 
 So even though it was God's will that David win, he operated within rules of his creation. 
 
 This is another great example of science and history and the Bible coming together. Not one account disproves the other. It is also another example of how the amazing is examplified in the every day - and we always miss it looking for magic acts.
 
 And I don't believe the word is more than the creation
 See above

 and also, as i was saying, we don't go bodily to heaven or hell and we do die.. our souls(it says somewhere in the Bible)go to our destination for eternity....then it says in the Bible that heaven and hell go to war..and God wins and then God makes a new earth

Everything you see is a miracle. It's beautiful and interesting - and the fact that we don't have all the answers yet is really, really cool.
 

 
 Thank you for thinking for yourself and not thinking there has to be an answer. I've never met a Christian who thinks like this and most Christians I know (personally, not here) are Christians because Christianity gives them answers. I think it is really, really cool that we don't know the answers. We can explore and try to figure it out, and the best part is you can never be wrong. But then there are always the people who try to convince you that their opinion is right and convert you. Use your freedom of mind to explore this beautiful life in a beautiful world that we have right now.

I think the word might be "tangential".

 Main Entry: 2tangent
 Function: noun
 1 : the mathematical function that for an acute angle in a right triangle is the ratio of the side opposite to the side adjacent
 2 : a tangent line, circle, or sphere
 3 : a sudden change of course <the speaker went off on a tangent< 
 Main Entry: tan·gen·tial 
 Pronunciation: tan-'jen(t)-sh&l
 Function: adjective
 1 : of, relating to, or of the nature of a tangent
 2 : acting along or lying in a tangent <tangential forces<
 3 a : DIVERGENT, DIGRESSIVE b : touching lightly : INCIDENTAL, PERIPHERAL <tangential involvement< Don't think so...............

 Both Kerry and Edwards have a history of opposing judicial nominees over their religious convictions. That's funny because I heard Senator Kerry admit that he had some religious convictions of his own. When asked what his position on abortion is, Kerry responds that life begins at conception and that his personal beliefs should not keep him from serving as President because it does not influence his public policy record.
 However, both he and Senator Edwards have repeatedly refused to extend that same courtesy to countless judicial nominees who happen to be pro-life. For example, Leon Holmes, who was recently confirmed by the Senate, was attacked by Kerry and Edwards' Democratic colleagues because he holds private Christian beliefs -- and Kerry didn't do a thing to stand up for him. If Sen. Kerry is such a defender of the ability to harbor private beliefs without allowing them to impact public decisions, he sure has a funny way of showing it.
 Sen. Kerry's position on same-sex "marriage" has often been confusing and a bit non-committal when it came to civil unions versus same-sex "marriage" rights. But the blatant pro-homosexual rhetoric on his campaign website leaves no doubt that he not only opposes the Federal Marriage Amendment but that he'll do anything in his power to ensure that homosexuals receive protected class status above the rest of us -- even if it means destroying the institution of marriage. A line from Kerry's proclamation states: "I am committed to using the power of the White House to advance equal rights for all Americans, including gay Americans."
 When asked, Kerry says he opposes same-sex "marriage." I don't believe it. All you have to do is look at the people this presidential campaign has surrounded itself with to see what their administration will look like. When it comes to protecting marriage, a future with "President Kerry" looks pretty bleak.
God_is_real
